title: Get started
text: INSPIRE Directive aims create European Union spatial data infrastructure purposes EU environmental policies policies activities may impact environment. European Spatial Data Infrastructure enable sharing environmental spatial information among public sector organisations, facilitate public access spatial information across Europe assist policy-making across boundaries. https://knowledge-base.inspire.ec.europa.eu/index_en implementation INSPIRE directive Cadastre Navarre allows retrieve spatial objects database cadastre: Vector objects: Parcels, addresses, buildings, cadastral zones . objects provided CatastRoNav sf objects (see ?sf::st_sf).

title: Get started
text: example retrieve cadastral parcels Olite: Example: Olite
code: library(CatastRoNav) # For getting coords library(sf) library(mapSpain) # Data wrangling and visualization library(dplyr) library(ggplot2)  olite <- esp_get_capimun(munic = "Olite") %>%   st_transform(25830) %>%   # Small buffer of 100 m   st_buffer(100)   cp <- catrnav_wfs_get_parcels_bbox(olite)   ggplot(cp) +   geom_sf()

title: Get started
text: can create also thematic maps using information available spatial objects. produce visualization urban growth Pamplona using CatastRoNav, replicating map produced Dominic Royé post Visualize urban growth. first place, extract coordinates city center Pamplona using mapSpain: Next step consists extracting buildings using WFS service: Next step creating visualization crop buildings buffer created : Let’s extract now construction year, available column beginning: Last step create groups based year create data visualization. use function ggplot2::cut_width() create different classes:
code: # Use mapSpain for getting the coords pamp <- esp_get_capimun(munic = "^Pamplona")  # Transform to ETRS89 / UTM 30 N and add a buffer of 750m  pamp_buff <- pamp %>%   st_transform(25830) %>%   st_buffer(1250) pamp_bu <- catrnav_wfs_get_buildings_bbox(pamp_buff, count = 10000) # Cut buildings  dataviz <- st_intersection(pamp_bu, pamp_buff) #> Error in UseMethod("st_intersection"): no applicable method for 'st_intersection' applied to an object of class "NULL"  ggplot(dataviz) +   geom_sf() #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'dataviz' not found # Extract 4 initial positions year <- substr(dataviz$beginning, 1, 4) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'dataviz' not found  # Replace all that doesn't look as a number with 0000 year[!(year %in% 0:2500)] <- "0000" #> Error: object 'year' not found  # To numeric year <- as.integer(year) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'year' not found  # New column dataviz <- dataviz %>%   mutate(year = year) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'dataviz' not found dataviz <- dataviz %>%   mutate(year_cat = ggplot2::cut_width(year, width = 10, dig.lab = 12)) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'dataviz' not found  # Adjust the color palette  dataviz_pal <- hcl.colors(length(levels(dataviz$year_cat)), "Spectral") #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'dataviz' not found  ggplot(dataviz) +   geom_sf(aes(fill = year_cat), color = NA) +   scale_fill_manual(values = dataviz_pal) +   theme_void() +   labs(title = "PAMPLONA", fill = "") +   theme(     panel.background = element_rect(fill = "black"),     plot.background = element_rect(fill = "black"),     legend.justification = .5,     legend.text = element_text(       colour = "white",       size = 12     ),     plot.title = element_text(       colour = "white", hjust = .5,       margin = margin(t = 30),       size = 30     ),     plot.caption = element_text(       colour = "white",       margin = margin(b = 20), hjust = .5     ),     plot.margin = margin(r = 40, l = 40)   ) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'dataviz' not found

title: Get started
text: Royé D (2019). “Visualize urban growth.” https://dominicroye.github.io/en/2019/visualize-urban-growth/.

code: @Manual{R-catastronav,   title = {{CatastRoNav}: Interface to the {API} {Catastro} de {Navarra}},   author = {Diego Hernangómez},   year = {2024},   version = {0.1.0},   doi = {10.5281/zenodo.6366407},   url = {https://ropenspain.github.io/CatastRoNav/},   abstract = {Access public spatial data available under the INSPIRE directive. Tools for downloading references, buildings and addresses of properties on Navarre (Spain).}, }

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Small typos grammatical errors documentation may edited directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. YES ✔️: edit roxygen comment .R file R/. ❌: edit .Rd file man/.

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: make substantial pull request, always file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s problem. ’ve found bug, create associated issue illustrate bug minimal reprex.

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: recommend create Git branch pull request (PR). Look R-CMD-check build status . making changes, run devtools::check() ensure new Notes, Warnings Errors appearing. recommend tidyverse style guide. also use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2. use testthat. Contributions test cases included easier accept. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md current development version header describing changes made followed GitHub username, links relevant issue(s)/PR(s).

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Email person listed maintainer DESCRIPTION file repo. Though note private discussions email don’t help others - course email totally warranted ’s sensitive problem kind.

what: Interface to the INSPIRE services of Catastro de Navarra
title: Interface to the INSPIRE services of Catastro de Navarra
text: CatastRoNav package provide access different API services Cadastre Navarre. CatastRoNav possible download spatial objects buildings cadastral parcels.

title: Interface to the INSPIRE services of Catastro de Navarra
text: can install developing version CatastRoNav using r-universe: Alternatively, can install developing version CatastRoNav :
code: # Install CatastRoNav in R: install.packages("CatastRoNav",   repos = c(     "https://ropenspain.r-universe.dev",     "https://cloud.r-project.org"   ) ) remotes::install_github("rOpenSpain/CatastRoNav", dependencies = TRUE)

title: Interface to the INSPIRE services of Catastro de Navarra
text: WFS service allows download vector objects specific cadastral elements. result provided sf objects (See sf package).
code: library(CatastRoNav) library(ggplot2)  wfs_get_buildings <- catrnav_wfs_get_buildings_bbox(   c(-1.652563, 42.478016, -1.646919, 42.483333),   srs = 4326 ) # Map ggplot(wfs_get_buildings) +   geom_sf() +   ggtitle("Olite, Navarra")

what: ATOM INSPIRE: Download all the cadastral parcels of a municipality — catrnav_atom_get_parcels
title: ATOM INSPIRE: Download all the cadastral parcels of a municipality — catrnav_atom_get_parcels
text: Get spatial data cadastral parcels belonging single municipality using INSPIRE ATOM service.

title: ATOM INSPIRE: Download all the cadastral parcels of a municipality — catrnav_atom_get_parcels
code: catrnav_atom_get_parcels(   munic,   cache = TRUE,   update_cache = FALSE,   cache_dir = NULL,   verbose = FALSE )

title: ATOM INSPIRE: Download all the cadastral parcels of a municipality — catrnav_atom_get_parcels
text: munic Municipality extract, can part string cadastral code. See catrnav_atom_get_parcels_db_all. cache logical whether caching. Default TRUE. See caching section catrnav_set_cache_dir(). update_cache logical whether update cache. Default FALSE. set TRUE force fresh download source file. cache_dir path cache directory. missing value function store cached files temporary dir (See base::tempdir()). verbose Logical, displays information. Useful debugging, default FALSE.

title: ATOM INSPIRE: Download all the cadastral parcels of a municipality — catrnav_atom_get_parcels
text: sf object.

text: SITNA – Catastro de Navarra

title: ATOM INSPIRE: Reference database for ATOM cadastral parcels — catrnav_atom_get_parcels_db_all
text: tibble information requested: munic: Name municipality. url: url downloading information corresponding municipality. date: Reference date data.

title: ATOM INSPIRE: Reference database for ATOM cadastral parcels — catrnav_atom_get_parcels_db_all
code: # \donttest{ catrnav_atom_get_parcels_db_all() #> # A tibble: 342 × 3 #>    munic                            url                               date       #>    <chr>                            <chr>                             <date>     #>  1 001 Abáigar                      https://filescartografia.navarra… 2024-06-30 #>  2 002 Abárzuza / Abartzuza         https://filescartografia.navarra… 2024-06-30 #>  3 003 Abaurregaina / Abaurrea Alta https://filescartografia.navarra… 2024-06-30 #>  4 004 Abaurrepea / Abaurrea Baja   https://filescartografia.navarra… 2024-06-30 #>  5 005 Aberin                       https://filescartografia.navarra… 2024-06-30 #>  6 006 Ablitas                      https://filescartografia.navarra… 2024-06-30 #>  7 007 Adiós                        https://filescartografia.navarra… 2024-06-30 #>  8 008 Aguilar de Codés             https://filescartografia.navarra… 2024-06-30 #>  9 009 Aibar / Oibar                https://filescartografia.navarra… 2024-06-30 #> 10 010 Altsasu / Alsasua            https://filescartografia.navarra… 2024-06-30 #> # ℹ 332 more rows # }

what: Clear your CatastRoNav cache dir — catrnav_clear_cache
title: Clear your CatastRoNav cache dir — catrnav_clear_cache
text: Use function caution. function clear cached data configuration, specifically: Deletes CatastRoNav config directory (rappdirs::user_config_dir("CatastRoNav", "R")). Deletes cache_dir directory. Deletes values stored Sys.getenv("CATASTRONAV_CACHE_DIR").

title: Clear your CatastRoNav cache dir — catrnav_clear_cache
code: catrnav_clear_cache(config = FALSE, cached_data = TRUE, verbose = FALSE)

title: Clear your CatastRoNav cache dir — catrnav_clear_cache
text: config TRUE, delete configuration folder CatastRoNav. cached_data set TRUE, delete cache_dir content. verbose Logical, displays information. Useful debugging, default FALSE.

title: Clear your CatastRoNav cache dir — catrnav_clear_cache
text: Invisible. function called side effects.

title: Clear your CatastRoNav cache dir — catrnav_clear_cache
text: overkill function intended reset status never installed /used CatastRoNav.

title: Clear your CatastRoNav cache dir — catrnav_clear_cache
code: # Don't run this! It would modify your current state # \dontrun{ catrnav_clear_cache(verbose = TRUE) #> CatastRoNav cached data deleted: C:\Users\RUNNER~1\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpSICVN2/CatastRoNav # }  Sys.getenv("CATASTRONAV_CACHE_DIR") #> [1] ""

what: Set your CatastRoNav cache dir — catrnav_set_cache_dir
title: Set your CatastRoNav cache dir — catrnav_set_cache_dir
text: catrnav_set_cache_dir() store cache_dir path local machine load future sessions. Alternatively, can store cache_dir manually following options: Run Sys.setenv(CATASTRONAV_CACHE_DIR = "cache_dir"). need run command session (Similar install = FALSE). Write line .Renviron file: CATASTRONAV_CACHE_DIR = "value_for_cache_dir" (behavior install = TRUE). store cache_dir permanently. catrnav_detect_cache_dir() detects returns path current cache_dir.

title: Set your CatastRoNav cache dir — catrnav_set_cache_dir
code: catrnav_set_cache_dir(   cache_dir,   overwrite = FALSE,   install = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE )  catrnav_detect_cache_dir(...)

title: Set your CatastRoNav cache dir — catrnav_set_cache_dir
text: cache_dir path cache directory. missing value function store cached files temporary dir (See base::tempdir()). overwrite set TRUE, overwrite existing CATASTRONAV_CACHE_DIR already local machine. install TRUE, install key local machine use future sessions.  Defaults FALSE. cache_dir FALSE parameter set FALSE automatically. verbose Logical, displays information. Useful debugging, default FALSE. ... Ignored

title: Set your CatastRoNav cache dir — catrnav_set_cache_dir
text: catrnav_set_cache_dir() called side effects, returns (invisible) character path cache_dir. catrnav_detect_cache_dir() returns path cache_dir used session

title: Set your CatastRoNav cache dir — catrnav_set_cache_dir
text: Sometimes cached files may corrupt. case, try re-downloading data setting update_cache = TRUE. experience problem download, try download corresponding file method save cache_dir. Use option verbose = TRUE debugging API query.

title: Set your CatastRoNav cache dir — catrnav_set_cache_dir
code: # Don't run this! It would modify your current state # \dontrun{ catrnav_set_cache_dir(verbose = TRUE) #> Using a temporary cache dir. Set 'cache_dir' to a value for store permanently #> CatastRoNav cache dir is: C:\Users\RUNNER~1\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpSICVN2/CatastRoNav # }   catrnav_detect_cache_dir() #> [1] "C:\\Users\\RUNNER~1\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\RtmpSICVN2/CatastRoNav"

what: Download addresses of Navarre in spatial format — catrnav_wfs_get_address_bbox
title: Download addresses of Navarre in spatial format — catrnav_wfs_get_address_bbox
text: Get spatial data addresses bounding box.

title: Download addresses of Navarre in spatial format — catrnav_wfs_get_address_bbox
code: catrnav_wfs_get_address_bbox(x, srs, verbose = FALSE, count = NULL)

title: Download addresses of Navarre in spatial format — catrnav_wfs_get_address_bbox
text: SITNA – Catastro de Navarra

title: Download addresses of Navarre in spatial format — catrnav_wfs_get_address_bbox
text: x See Details. : numeric vector length 4 coordinates defines bounding box: c(xmin, ymin, xmax, ymax). sf/sfc object, provided sf package. srs SRS/CRS use query. See Details. verbose Logical, displays information. Useful debugging, default FALSE. count integer, indicating maximum number features return. default value NULL pass parameter query, maximum number features determined default value API service (5,000 case).

title: Download addresses of Navarre in spatial format — catrnav_wfs_get_address_bbox
text: sf object.

title: Download addresses of Navarre in spatial format — catrnav_wfs_get_address_bbox
text: x numeric vector, make sure srs matches coordinate values. Additionally, srs correspond geographic reference system (4326, 4258), function queries bounding box EPSG:25830 - ETRS89 / UTM zone 30N. result provided always SRS provided srs. x sf object, value srs ignored. query performed using EPSG:25830 (ETRS89 / UTM zone 30N) spatial object projected back SRS initial object.

title: Download addresses of Navarre in spatial format — catrnav_wfs_get_address_bbox
code: # \donttest{ downtown <- c(-1.646812, 42.814528, -1.638036, 42.820320)  ad <- catrnav_wfs_get_address_bbox(downtown, srs = 4326)  library(ggplot2)  ggplot(ad) +   geom_sf()  # }

title: CatastRoNav 0.1.0
text: Improve condition handling. Add count parameter allows set maximum number features returned. Support ATOM cadastral parcels added, see catrnav_atom_get_parcels(). ATOM capabilities added Cadastre Navarra make available. New caching system, see catrnav_set_cache_dir() catrnav_detect_cache_dir(). New dependency: rappdirs .

title: CatastRoNav 0.0.2
text: Make  objects valid sf::st_make_valid().

title: CatastRoNav 0.0.1
text: Initial release.

title: CatastRoNav 0.0.0.9000
